S3 Public File URL
How do I create a public URL for a single S3 object without changing bucket policy?
I need a permanent, public link to one file in a private S3 bucket (no public policy).
Is a presigned URL the only option?
If so, what’s the recommended expiration or best practice?

Hello.
If you do not use a bucket policy, you will need to publish using a signed URL.
Best practices for signed URLs are described in the following documents:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/prescriptive-guidance/latest/presigned-url-best-practices/overview.html
If you want to make an object public permanently, the easiest way to set it up is to edit the bucket policy and make it public, as described in the following document.
https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/read-access-objects-s3-bucket
